articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: Lionel Messi. For some, the greatest of his generation. For others, the greatest to ever play the game. Millions, in Argentina and world wide, are willing him to win the greatest tournament of them all. The next stop on that quest in Qatar 2022 is the SPFL Select, sorry Australia.
articles.title: Australia v Argentina - Hearts star's value, Celtic and Dundee United duo impress, stopping Lionel Messi

articles.author: Angus Wright
articles.description: Celtic have been backed to have a “plan already in place” if Giorgos Giakoumakis was to leave the club – and the Scottish champions have been linked with an in-form Dutch striker.
articles.title: 'Plan already in place' - Celtic linked with in-form ace as Postecoglou backed to replace Giorgos Giakoumakis

articles.author: Mark Atkinson
articles.description: Celtic’s stock is understandably at an all-time high in Japan.
articles.title: Yuki Kobayashi explains Celtic move, lifts lid on Kyogo talks and what manager expects of him

articles.author: Mark Atkinson
articles.description: Celtic manager Ange Postecoglou says he will deal with any issues as they arise with the happiness of his squad after reports this week that striker Giorgios Giakoumakis will look to leave the club in January after contract talks broke down.
articles.title: 'I'll deal with it': Ange Postecoglou has say on potential issues within squad amid Giorgos Giakoumakis speculation

articles.author: Mark Atkinson
articles.description: Celtic manager Ange Postecoglou hopes there will be developments soon on the potential signing of defender Alistair Johnston.
articles.title: Ange Postecoglou has say on potential Alistair Johnston and Cho Gue-sung Celtic transfers

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: Hearts and Celtic’s January fixtures at Livingston and Dundee United respectively have been rescheduled for television.
articles.title: Hearts and Celtic games moved for TV coverage as Sky announce latest  of 11 live fixtures

articles.author: Mark Atkinson
articles.description: Celtic have announced that Peter Lawwell will take up the role of non-executive chairman of the club next month.
articles.title: Peter Lawwell's new Celtic role: What Desmond, Postecoglou, Bankier and man himself had to say about appointment

articles.author: Angus Wright
articles.description: Tottenham Hotspur manager Antonio Conte could look to Celtic star Josip Juranovic to improve his options on the right of defence, according to a former Spurs and England star.
articles.title: Tottenham Hotspur tipped to have interest in Celtic World Cup star as 'low millions' signing praised for impact

articles.author: Angus Wright
articles.description: Celtic will face a fight to land South Korean World Cup star Gue-sung Cho with reported competition from Europe.
articles.title: Celtic face fight to land striker target as Scottish champions get tidy World Cup cash boost

articles.author: Mark Atkinson
articles.description: Just when you thought you’d seen it all. If Wednesday’s Group C drama with Argentina, Poland, Mexico and Saudi Arabia wasn’t enough for you, then surely what we witnessed in Group E on Thursday has left you sated.
articles.title: Controversial, crazy two hours: Japan, Spain, Germany and Costa Rica involved in World Cup's greatest group denouement

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: VAR is set to be used in the Scottish Cup, starting from the fourth round next month with the arrival of the Premiership sides.
articles.title: VAR to be used in the Scottish Cup from the fourth round - but only up to 6 of the 16 fixtures

articles.author: Mark Atkinson
articles.description: Celtic right-back Josip Juranovic put in another assured display for Croatia as they secured their place in the last 16 of the World Cup with a 0-0 draw against Belgium.
articles.title: Josip Juranovic enhances Celtic value with fine Croatia display as Alistair Johnston has bad miss for Canada

articles.author: Angus Wright
articles.description: Celtic are to receive a huge injury boost with Callum McGregor scheduled to make his return to first-team action ahead of the Premiership restart later this month.
articles.title: Celtic set for huge injury boost as Callum McGregor eyes first-team return ahead of Premiership restart

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: Tucked in behind housing estates and cul-de-sacs, across the road from a car garage, surrounded by industrial estates and a sign for a food truck is the nondescript office buildings in Baillieston which acts as the epicentre to one of the biggest and arguably the most controversial of changes to Scottish football. VAR.
articles.title: VAR in Scottish football - 30 games, the investment, the benefits, the improvements but one question persists

articles.author: Angus Wright
articles.description: Celtic are keen on South Korean World Cup star Gue-sung Cho but will likely face stiff competition from around Europe.
articles.title: Celtic line up second World Cup star, 21-goal South Korean but ace could exit as contract talks stall

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: Scottish FA chief Ian Maxwell has said VAR "has worked” with the Scottish Premiership benefiting from an eight per cent increase in the success rate for big decisions in games since its introduction.
articles.title: Scottish Premiership benefits from VAR with 8% increase in correct decisions as SFA claims 'it has worked'

articles.author: Moira Gordon
articles.description: As Australia edged towards a clutch of World Cup firsts, including their first spot in the last 16 since 2006, two group wins for the first time, and their first clean sheet in 11 attempts against a European side on the greatest stage, there was almost grudging respect from pundits who, even at half-time, were predicting this would be the Socceroos curtain call.
articles.title: Kye Rowles, Harry Souttar and Aaron Mooy all shine as Australia make history and book a place in last 16

articles.author: Angus Wright
articles.description: Celtic are closing in on completing the signing of Canada’s World Cup star Alistair Johnston.
articles.title: Alistair Johnston: €4m Celtic transfer could be 'announced soon' as defender to become second January signing

articles.author: Mark Atkinson
articles.description: The Scottish Cup fourth round draw was made on Monday evening and golfer Ewen Ferguson, charged with pulling the balls out of the hat, certainly delivered some tasty ties.
articles.title: Scottish Cup R4 ties: The games that are candidates for TV picks and when they might be played

articles.author: Angus Wright
articles.description: Matt O’Riley says Celtic are “aware” of the good position they are in right now in the cinch Premiership but insists they will continue to focus purely on themselves after Rangers changed managers in the past week.
articles.title: Celtic 'aware' of good position but full focus is on 'their own stuff' despite changes at Rangers

articles.author: Ross McLeish
articles.description: Alistair Johnston is on the verge of a move to Celtic from Montreal CF for £3million and the Canada right-back played against one of his potential team-mates at the World Cup last weekend when the Maple Leafs came up against Croatia.
articles.title: Inside the Celtic chat between Josip Juranovic and Alistair Johnston - 'he brought situation up'

articles.description:
Ange Postecoglou is delighted to get Yuki Kobayashi in the door at Celtic, believing the chance to sign him at the end of his contract was too good to turn down. Kobayashi is arriving as a free agent from Vissel Kobe, where he made 78 appearances in total at the heart of their defensive line. ...

articles.title: Ange Postecoglou talks up Celtic bargain

articles.description:
Ange Postecoglou refused to be drawn on reported Celtic interest in Alistair Johnston today but did reaffirm his intent to have the Bhoys in a stronger position at the end of January. Celtic have been widely reported to be on the brink of a move for Johnston in recent days, potentially becoming the club’s second ...

articles.title: Ange Postecoglou swerves Alistair Johnston question but states exciting Celtic January intent

articles.description: Founded in 1887 in the East End of Glasgow by founding father Brother Walfrid, Celtic is the biggest football clubs in the World and the only club from Scotland to win the European Cup, now the Champions League, to become Champions of Europe.The club is one of five across the globe to have won over Read More
articles.title: Best International Players to Play for Celtic this Century

articles.description: As my good friend Paddy Sinat over on Vital Celtic said earlier on today, and as others echoed in the past few hours, the club announced Peter Lawwell’s appointment as chairman in the most low key way possible. I noticed it when I saw the official club statement. When we announce a signing or an […]
articles.title: If The Lawwell Appointment Is Such A Good One, Why Are Celtic Low-Keying It?

articles.description:
Reo Hatate advised new Celtic signing Yuki Kobayashi to rest as much as possible prior to his big move to Scotland, having experienced fatigue after his switch last season. Kobayashi, like Daizen Maeda, Reo Hatate and Yosuke Ideguchi before him, are arriving in Glasgow after a long J-League season that is played over the summer ...

articles.title: Reo Hatate's helpful advice for new Celtic signing

articles.description:
Celtic are “very interested” in Dutch attacker Said Hamulic, TuttoMercatoWeb in Italy have reported this week. The outlet believes that clubs from France, Belgium, Italy and the Netherlands are tracking the progress of the versatile forward, who currently plays for Stal Mielic in the Polish top flight. But it’s said Celtic are showing the most ...
The post Report: Celtic showing serious interest in 9-goal Dutch attacker appeared first on 67 Hail Hail.
articles.title: Report: Celtic showing serious interest in 9-goal Dutch attacker

articles.description: As the song goes ‘for a minute there, I lost myself’. I was under the impression Celtic had begun to modernise, had started to play catch-up with those football clubs who had taken advantage of our hitherto decade of inertia to embrace modern analytical processes and think outside the box in the recruitment of players, Read More
articles.title: The gaslighting of the Celtic support has returned alongside Peter Lawwell

articles.description:
Callum McGregor is “ready to go” and make an impact for Celtic once again, Ange Postecoglou confirmed today as the midfielder returned to full first-team squad training. McGregor travelled with the group to Sydney but looked to be taking part in non-contact training as he rehabilitated from the knee injury sustained against RB Leipzig on ...
The post Celtic hero returns to full first-team training after 2 month absence appeared first on 67 Hail Hail.
articles.title: Celtic hero returns to full first-team training after 2 month absence

articles.description: What a superb answer Ange gave today to the obvious question about the new boss at Ibrox. Beale is the new darling of the media, and this city can only really have one of those at a time. Ange will not give up that crown without a fight. Beale may have smarmed them, but Ange […]
articles.title: The Celtic Boss’s Michael Beale Slap-Down Was Deliciously, Devilishly Dismissive.

articles.description: An indication of just how far the Celtic Fan Media has developed over the last couple of years is the fact that the quite excellent Celtic Exchange podcast, yesterday managed to get an exclusive interview with former Celtic manager Martin O’Neill. We’ll cover this on The Celtic Star over the next few days starting this Read More
articles.title: Martin O’Neill: “Brian Clough Changed My Life Forever” – A Celtic Exchange Exclusive

articles.description: New Celtic signing Yuki Kobayashi touched down in Glasgow today. I was in attendance at the fan media press conference. I was impressed with what I heard. He sounded up to the test and has a great idea of what he has to do to make a name for himself at the club. When asked […]
articles.title: Yuki Kobayashi Press Conference

articles.description: It is impossible not to marvel at the life of Leigh Griffiths away from the football pitch. Every time he seems as if he might get his act together on the field and give himself a chance of rebuilding something of his career he is spectacularly derailed by something that rises out of the headlines […]
articles.title: Leigh Griffiths: A Man Ever In Search Of A Negative Headline.

articles.description: Celtic forward Giorgos Giakoumakis is poised for a surprise January exit from the Premiership champions, according to reliable reporters Scott Burns and Duncan Castles. Scottish FA Chief Executive Ian Maxwell doesn’t believe the perception of the decision to rule Celtic star Jota offside against Motherwell matters, because VAR technology got the offside call right regardless. There was controversy in the wake of the Bhoys win over the Steelmen last month after one of the cameras in operation failed to ...

articles.description:
CeltsAreHere attended this year’s AGM where the question of who would succeed Ian Bankier as Celtic chairman came up during the shareholder Q&A. Ian Bankier will be stepping down as chairman when the clock strikes midnight on Hogmanay. We’re now into December with no news of his successor to date. Mr Bankier responded to the […]

Daizen Maeda’s Japan will play Josip Juranovic’s Croatia in the last 16 of the World Cup after a dramatic day of action at the Qatar tournament. Japan, remarkably, finished as winners of Group E after beating both Germany and Spain over the last week. Meanwhile, Croatia are also through, drawing with Belgium today to secure ...

articles.description: Over the last couple of days, the Ibrox fans have been treated to the views of people who should never, ever open a corner shop. Financially illiterate, bloated with the usual supremacist guff and completely impervious to the lessons of history they have demanded insanity from the club that they profess to have the deepest […]
articles.title: Ex-Ibrox Players Line Up To Urge Sevco To Adopt The Strategy That Killed Rangers.

Former Celtic striker Frank McAvennie believes Joe Hart won’t be Celtic’s number one by this time next year, tipping his current understudy Benjamin Siegrist to become the new hoops number one. Joe has been a stalwart in Ange Postecoglou’s side since making the £1m move from Spurs 18 months ago. Joe has been a fantastic […]

Tan McManus believes Celtic could and should cash in on Josip Juranovic in January after the emergence of Alistair Johnston as a top January target. Johnston played his final game of the World Cup on Thursday evening and now looked destined to head to the Hoops sooner rather than later. It leaves Juranovic’s future up […]

Video Assistant Referees (VAR) will be used in the Scottish Cup from the Fourth Round stage, but only for matches where the Scottish Premiership side is at home, The Scotsman has reported this evening. Two very well placed sources in Scott Burns and Duncan Castles have reported Giakoumakis is unhappy with his current Celtic deal and is looking for […]

CELTIC are chasing the signing of another World Cup star — this time Ange wants South Korea striker Cho Gue-sung to join the Hoops in Glasgow. SunSport has revealed the Scottish Champions are keen to bring in her 6ft 2” frontman who Ange has been watching since before he became the manager of Celtic. The […]

articles.description: The 18th of November marked the 50th anniversary of my first time attending a Celtic game. Or the first one certainly that I can remember. On that day in 1972 my old Dad took me to see Celtic at the tender age of 6, and although it wasn’t actually the first time he had taken […]
articles.title: 50 YEARS A CELT

articles.description: Michael Beale. What a start he’s made as Ibrox gaffer. He’s closed the gap just by opening his gob. He has Ryan Kent playing brilliantly, albeit in training against his own mates. He has taken “the cards” out of the hands of the contract rebels, although they can still talk to any club they want […]
articles.title: Beale Has Proved Good At Running His Mouth. We’ll See What Else He’s Got.

articles.description:
There were a total of nine arrivals at Celtic during the summer, with a few of the previous season’s players signing permanent deals. The trio of Jota, Daizen Maeda and Cameron Carter-Vickers trio had all been on loan at the Hoops during the previous term and played a huge part in the club winning two […]

The Celtic midfielder was impressive again as the Socceroos booked their second spot in Group D behind reigning champions France on a day of high drama. Mathew Leckie scored a superb goal [...]

The 32-year-old was given the seemingly daunting task of curbing Manchester United’s Christian Eriksen.Mooy was excellent in breaking up the Danes as they tried to push forward, marking Eriksen out of the game and limited them Read More

ANGE POSTECOGLOU’s former assistant Peter Cklamovski has claimed that the Celtic manager is one of the best in the business but has admitted he’ll soon be in the Premier League to prove it. articles.description:
The Celtic Park Sports Bar will now be open every weekend, with the newest addition to the stadium initially opening on match days. [Celtic FC] Punters can now enjoy a drink with some bar snacks out with match days, and is a great addition for those touring the stadium across the weekend, for a before/after […]

articles.description:
CELTIC WOMEN are trying to attract fans with the mens team currently on a break. Fran Alsonso’s side are playing Dundee United on Sunday, with a 16.10 kick off. It’s a great time to watch the side, looking to get back to winning ways after their derby draw at the weekend. The fixture is set […]

The midfielder joins Celtic defender Cameron Carter-Vickers in the next round of the competition, with half of the Hoops’ stars now secured a knockout place stage. Josip […]
